intro: Licania takutuensis, commonly known as the Takutu river licania, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
